b.span: The Lee Public Schools will be closed until Monday, May 4th, due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

div.p: Welcome to the Lee Public School District Web site. The Lee Public Schools are located in the Berkshire Hills of Western Massachusetts just minutes from the Massachusetts Turnpike and numerous world class tourist and cultural destinations. We educate students from the towns of Lee and Tyringham, and other neighboring communities through school choice and tuition agreements.
Our community has a history of supporting its public schools, as evidenced by our beautiful campus and our two school buildings. We are grateful to be a part of such a supportive community.

ul.style: font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 100%; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-weight: normal;

meta.div:
In conjunction with the Town of Lee, the Lee Public Schools are actively working to keep everyone well during these challenging times associated with the COVID-19 virus. One particular way that we are striving to be helpful is in regard to meal availability, at least in the foreseeable future. Beginning Tuesday, March 24, we will be making weekly packages of meals available to residents in Lee and Lee PS students from Tyringham. These will consist of five days worth of breakfasts and lunches. In order to assist us in planning for this venture, it will be important for you to let us know if you would like to take advantage of this opportunity. At this time, we are planning to deliver these packages to residents so there will be no need for you to leave home in order to benefit from this service.
It is the Town’s intent to provide for those in need or otherwise grappling with food insecurity during this public health emergency. Town staff and volunteers will deliver any requested meals directly to your residence. Any resident in need of a meal should follow the instructions below:
INSTRUCTIONS FOR REQUESTING MEALS
1. Before NOON on each Friday, please call the Lee Public Schools Meal Delivery Hotline at (413) 243-0336 EXT 3333 and leave a voicemail with:
a. YOUR NAME
b. STREET ADDRESS
c. TELEPHONE NUMBER
d. NUMBER OF MEALS (limit one per person, per day)
e. AGES OF CHILDREN IN THE HOME
OR
2. Before NOON on each Friday, please email the Lee Public Schools Meal Delivery Hotline email
lunches@leepublicschools.net and provide
a. YOUR NAME
b. STREET ADDRESS
c. TELEPHONE NUMBER
d. NUMBER OF MEALS (limit one per person, per day)
e. AGES OF CHILDREN IN THE HOME
3. Meals will be delivered beginning around 11:30am until further notice.
If you have any questions and/or concerns, please contact lunches@leepublicschools.net for further assistance.
Sincerely,
Michael J. Richard
Superintendent of Schools
Christopher J. Ketchen
Chief Administrative Officer / Town Administrator

I would like to take this opportunity to introduce myself to the communities of Lee and Tyringham. It has been a wonderful couple of weeks getting acclimated to the district. I have spent time in classrooms, meeting with students and staff, and getting immersed in the activities that define our schools and communities. Of note are the extraordinary students and staff. Their commitment to excellence and success is readily apparent in the instructional spaces and in public, too! The Lee Public Schools provide all students with access to a rigorous and challenging educational experience cultivated through the formation of meaningful relationships.
The next couple of months are riddled with activities. Included among them is the administration of MCAS. I encourage all families to remember a few things as testing rolls around. Please encourage students to get a good night’s rest, to eat well-balanced meals, and to include some physical activity in their daily regimine.
The success of our schools is dependent on active and appropriate engagement by all stakeholders. To that end, I encourage you to seek out ways to be involved in any number of ways, including: coaching, tutoring, volunteering, chaperoning, or joining our district as an employee.
To get updates on what’s happening around LPS and the education world, please consider following me on Twitter @LeeSchoolsSupt.
Thank you for welcoming me to Lee and do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.
All the best,
Michael J. Richard

div.div:
Every year, the Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education releases a report card for each school and district in the state. Just as a student's report card shows how they are doing in different classes, school and district report cards are designed to show parents and community members how a school or district is doing in different areas. Report cards highlight a school or district's strengths as well as any challenges that need to be addressed in order to make sure the needs of all students are being met.
DESE School and District Report Cards

Profiles are critical tools for promoting accountability for schools and districts by publicizing data about student performance and program effectiveness for parents, policy makers, and other stakeholders. They help parents and the general public see where schools and districts are succeeding and where there is still work to do. Districts receiving Title I funds must prepare and disseminate annual report cards.
Lee Elementary School Profile
Lee Middle and High School Profile
Lee District Profile
